hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: KERNELREPO
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: Git repository to use when cloning the kernel.

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: KERNELTAG
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: Kernel tag to use; it can also be a commit id.

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: RESOURCES
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: Space separated list of hostnames onto which to run the test

hudson.tasks.Shell.command:
# Get list of resources locked by this build. RESOURCES=${RESOURCES:-$(cd ${JENKINS_HOME} && ./resourceslockedby.py ${JOB_BASE_NAME}#${BUILD_NUMBER})}
# Create csv header. :> plot.csv for R in ${RESOURCES}; do echo -n \"${R}\", >> plot.csv done truncate --size=-1 plot.csv echo >> plot.csv
# Kernel version to use. KERNVER=${KERNVER:-$(echo ${JOB_BASE_NAME} | grep -oP '(?<=\.)v.+\..+(?=\.)' || :;)}
TIMEOUT=1800 ITERATIONS=1
# Run test on each resource. for R in ${RESOURCES}; do # In order to execute in parallel, each # ressource test run within its own subshell. ( # Insure resource provisioned for test. if ! (cd ${JENKINS_HOME} && ./checkresourceprovisioned.sh ${R}) &> ${R}.checkresourceprovisioned.log; then # Continue on to the next resource if # the provision-check fail on this resource. continue fi # Check if a new kernel need to be installed. if ssh -q jenkins@${R} './checkfornewkerneltag.sh https://github.com/torvalds/linux.git' ${KERNVER} &> ${R}.checkfornewkerneltag.log; then # Get the version built. kernbuilt=$(ssh -q jenkins@${R} ls kernel/linux-image* | grep -oP "(?<=linux-image-).+(?=-jenkins_)") # Reboot resource into kernel version built. (cd ${JENKINS_HOME} && ./rebootresource.sh jenkins@${R} ${kernbuilt} &> /dev/null) fi echo "${R}: $(ssh -q jenkins@${R} 'uname -r')" > ${R}.kernelrelease
timeout -sKILL ${TIMEOUT} ssh -q jenkins@${R} &> ${R}.ssh.log <<-EOF # remove any sos repo; as it conflicts; # it will be restored by test neededing it. sudo rm /etc/apt/sources.list.d/*sos* sudo apt update
# Remove any previous lkp result. #sudo rm -rf /lkp/result/*
# make working directory. mkdir -p lkp-tests-runs
cd lkp-tests-runs
# Generate hackbench tests. lkp split-job ../lkp-tests/jobs/hackbench.yaml
# Install test dependencies. sudo lkp install ./hackbench-50%-process-pipe.yaml
# Run test. sudo lkp run ./hackbench-50%-process-pipe.yaml EOF
if [ ${PIPESTATUS[0]} -eq 0 ]; then AVOCADO_LOG_PATH=$(cat ${R}.ssh.log | fgrep 'JOB LOG' | grep -oP '(?<=: ).+$') scp jenkins@${R}:${AVOCADO_LOG_PATH} ${R}.avocado.log plotval=$(echo $(cat ${R}.avocado.log | fgrep 'Time Taken:' | grep -oP '(?<=Time Taken:)[0-9.]+$') /${ITERATIONS} | bc -l) # Average with previous value if available, # in an attempt to remove noise from plots. if [ -f ${R}.prevplotval ]; then plotval=$(echo \($(cat ${R}.prevplotval)+${plotval}\)/2 | bc -l) fi echo -n "${plotval}" > ${R}.prevplotval echo -n "${plotval}" > ${R}.plotval fi ) & done
# Wait for all subshells. wait
# Generate "Kernel Release:" line for # the "Set Build Description" plugin. echo -n "Kernel Release: " > kernelreleases for R in ${RESOURCES}; do if [ -f ${R}.kernelrelease ]; then echo -n "$(cat ${R}.kernelrelease 2>/dev/null | grep -oP '.+(?=-jenkins)'), " >> kernelreleases fi done truncate --size=-2 kernelreleases echo [$(cat kernelreleases)]
# Finalize csv with plot values. for R in ${RESOURCES}; do echo -n "$(cat ${R}.plotval 2>/dev/null)," >> plot.csv done truncate --size=-1 plot.csv echo >> plot.csv
